remarks: If for every element of an indexing set ` A ` there exists a corresponding element of another set ` B ` , then there exists a subset of ` B ` consisting only of those elements which are indexed by ` A ` . Used to avoid the Axiom of Choice in situations where only the range of the choice function is needed.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
statement:
indexa $p |- ( ( B e. M /\ A. x e. A E. y e. B ph ) -> E. c ( c C_ B /\ A. x e. A E. y e. c ph /\ A. y e. c E. x e. A ph ) ) $.
$d A c x y $.
$d B c x y $.
$d c ph $.
